info.title: One Stream CRUD API Reference
info.description: A comprehensive REST API for managing streams and stream types with full CRUD operations. Built with Laravel 12, featuring PostgreSQL database, interactive documentation, and a modern web interface.

get.operationId: Handles the API request and renders the Swagger documentation view.

x-code-samples.source: curl -X GET -G "http://localhost:8000/api/documentation"

get.operationId: Handles requests for API documentation and returns the corresponding file content.

info.title: One Stream CRUD API
info.description: API documentation for the Streams CRUD system

get.summary: List streams with filtering and pagination
get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of streams with optional filtering and sorting

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by title or description (supports both 'search' and 'q' parameters)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: JSON:API style sorting (use '-' prefix for descending)

post.description: Create a new stream with the provided data

get.description: Retrieve a single stream by its ID

put.description: Update an existing stream with the provided data

delete.description: Soft delete a stream (marks as deleted but doesn't remove from database)

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available stream types

post.description: Create a new stream type with the given name

put.description: Update an existing stream type by ID

name.description: Updated name of the stream type

delete.description: Delete an existing stream type by ID

get.description: Retrieve a list of all users in the system

post.description: Create a new user with the given information

put.description: Update an existing user by ID

name.description: Updated full name of the user

email.description: Updated email address of the user

password.description: New password for the user (optional, minimum 8 characters)

delete.description: Delete an existing user by ID. Users cannot delete their own account.

message.example: You cannot delete your own account

x-code-samples.source: curl -X GET -G "http://localhost:8000/api/docs"

get.operationId: Serves a specific documentation asset for the Swagger UI interface.

example.message: (1) - this L5 Swagger asset is not allowed

x-code-samples.source: curl -X GET -G "http://localhost:8000/api/docs/asset/{asset}"

get.operationId: Handles the OAuth2 callback and retrieves the required file for the redirect.

x-code-samples.source: curl -X GET -G "http://localhost:8000/api/oauth2-callback"

get.operationId: Display a listing of the resource.

example.message: The title field is required. (and 2 more errors)

title: The title field is required.
tokens_price: The tokens price field is required.
